Name: Ring Keypad v2
Description: Ring Alarm Keypad is a wireless accessory for the Ring Alarm system which provides users the ability to arm and disarm their system, view system status, and manage alarm conditions. After installing the Keypad and setting up the Keypad in the Ring app, perform arming and disarming actions as well as receive system indications for different status updates and events. The Ring Alarm Base Station is required to enable Keypad features and functions within the Ring app.
Description_Short: Ring Alarm Keypad is a wireless accessory for the Ring Alarm system which provides users the ability to arm and disarm their system, view system status, and manage alarm conditions.

AssociationGroups.Description:
This is the Lifeline group with the following command class support -
1.	Notification Report
a.	See notification CC section for notifications that are sent
2.	Entry Control Notification
3.	Battery Report
4.	Device Reset Locally Notification

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Heartbeat Interval
ConfigurationParameters.Description: This parameter is the number minutes between heartbeats. Heartbeats are automatic battery reports on a timer after the last event.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the interval between heartbeats in minutes.
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the interval between heartbeats in minutes.

ConfigurationParameters.Description: Timeout in seconds when any button is pressed, but a sequence is not completed and buttons are no longer being pressed

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the Timeout in seconds when any button is pressed.
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the Timeout in seconds when any button is pressed.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Status Change Display Timeout

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the percentage level at which the display would turn on the red battery indicator.
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the percentage level at which the display would turn on the red battery indicator.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Application Retries
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Number of application level retries attempted for messages either not ACKed or messages encapsulated via supervision get that did not receive a report.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the number of application level retries attempted for messages

ConfigurationParameters.Description: Configurable ON time for the blink for config #22 which allows us to modify the time for the LED to be active when set to blink on a period per config 22.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the Configurable ON time for the blink.
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the Configurable ON time for the blink.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Supervision Report Timeout
ConfigurationParameters.Description: The number of milliseconds waiting for a Supervisory Report response to a Supervisory Get encapsulated command from the sensor before attempting a retry.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the number of milliseconds waiting for a Supervisory Report response to a Supervisory Get encapsulated command from the sensor before attempting a retry.
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the number of milliseconds waiting for a Supervisory Report response to a Supervisory Get encapsulated command from the sensor before attempting a retry.

ConfigurationParameters.Description:
System Security Mode Display: (Always, Sometimes, Never).

601 = Always On

1 - 600 = periodic interval

0 = Always Off, except when there's activit

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Long press emergency duration (seconds)
ConfigurationParameters.Description: This parameter allows a user to configure the duration in seconds for the hold time required to capture a long press . This includes Emergency Buttons + Mode Buttons (Police, Fire, Medical, Disarmed, Home, Away)

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the special key long press duration -  hold time required to capture a long press in seconds.
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the special key long press duration -  hold time required to capture a long press in seconds.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Long press number pad duration (seconds)
ConfigurationParameters.Description: This parameter allows a user to configure the duration in seconds for the hold time required to capture a long press . This includes Number Pad + Check & X (0-9, Check, X)

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the hold time required to capture a long press in seconds.
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the hold time required to capture a long press in seconds.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: This parameter is the Timeout in seconds when proximity is detected and no input is received
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: This parameter is the Timeout in seconds when proximity is detected and no input is received

Documents.description: Z Wave logo and QR code on Product

Texts.description: Where to find S2 DSK on product
Texts.value: The 5-digit DSK pin found on the package of the Ring Alarm Keypad or the 5-digit DSK pin found under the QR code on the device.

After powering on the device, press and hold the #1 button for ~3 seconds. Release the button and the device will enter Classic inclusion mode which implements both classic inclusion with a Node Information Frame, and Network Wide Inclusion. During Classic Inclusion mode, the green Connection LED will blink three times followed by a brief pause, repeatedly. When Classic inclusion times-out, the device will blink alternating red and green a few times.

Exclusion Instructions: 
1.	Initiate remove “Ring Alarm Keypad” flow in the Ring Alarm mobile application – Select the settings icon from device details page and choose “Remove Device” to remove the device. This will place the controller into Remove or “Z-Wave Exclusion” mode. 
2.	Locate the pinhole reset button on the back of the device. 
3.	With the controller in Remove (Z-Wave Exclusion) mode, use a paper clip or similar object and tap the pinhole button. The device’s Connection LED turns on solid red to indicate the device was removed from the network.
Not applicable. Ring Alarm Keypad (LSS) is a Frequently Listening Receiver Slave (FLiRS) device and does not support Wake Up Command Class.

Factory Default Instructions 
1.	To restore Ring Alarm Keypad to factory default settings, locate the pinhole reset button on the device. This is found on the back of the device after removing the back bracket. 
2.	Using a paperclip or similar object, insert it into the pinhole, press and hold the button down for 10 seconds. 
3.	The device’s Connection icon LED will rapidly blink green continuously for 10 seconds. After about 10 seconds, when the green blinking stops, release the button. The red LED will turn on solid to indicate the device was removed from the network. 

Note: Use this procedure only in the event that the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.

SupportedNotificationTypes.notification: Power status: Power has been applied
SW status: System software failure (manufacturer proprietary failure code provided)
